name: ABC
text: Critics say mixed messages from the White House harmed the initial response to COVID-19, while a top federal health official says, “we can turn these curves around.” https://t.co/A2XpNxfuPE #COVIDinAmerica https://t.co/g4VGvMADgq

name: ABC
text: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, who recently announced that she is battling a recurrence of liver cancer, has been hospitalized in New York City after undergoing a "minimally invasive non-surgical procedure," according to a Supreme Court spokeswoman. https://t.co/gyzAzQYtit

name: ABC
text:
Doctors "revised a bile duct stent" that was originally placed in Ginsburg last summer, court spokeswoman Kathy Arberg said in a statement. 

Arberg said Ginsburg is "resting comfortably" and expects to be released from the hospital by the end of the week. https://t.co/DkjtWNuiL2

text: A freight train derailed on a bridge in Tempe, Arizona, setting the bridge ablaze and partially collapsing the structure, officials said. https://t.co/fqwBC7gjoL https://t.co/YLcEhDSboY

text:
EYE ON THE TIGER: Conservation groups release footage of rare Indochinese tigers in Thailand to mark International Tiger Day. 

These sightings were the first time the species has been seen in the this region of Thailand in four years. https://t.co/orzAIQuGtI https://t.co/4fulRCcTQh

text:

text: Although studies are limited and the syndrome is considered very rare, MIS-C is a serious illness that has lead to many child hospitalizations. https://t.co/qqsZVKlaNO

name: ABC
text: BREAKING: In a remarkable move by a sitting president, Pres. Trump suggests delaying the presidential election over his persistent false attacks about mail-in voting. It's not within the power of the president to delay the election. https://t.co/Tn8Akb5TGn

name: ABC
text: Authorities in New York City are ramping up efforts to crack down on massive parties and other large gatherings as more videos pop up on social media showing mask-less revelers flouting the rules. https://t.co/hfeEPANNe0

name: ABC
text: In the age of COVID and racial outrage, this year's campaign is unique. https://t.co/6pkl5Lo0BT

text: TO THE RESCUE: Authorities in Massachusetts rescued a leatherback sea turtle that got tangled in rope in Buzzards Bay, near Cape Cod. https://t.co/REOcMUPGDM https://t.co/pehhmpbjHT

text: BREAKING: Former GOP presidential candidate Herman Cain has died, his website says, nearly one month after his coronavirus diagnosis was announced. https://t.co/IKroC9szdr

text: Speaker Nancy Pelosi responds to Pres. Trump's tweet suggesting delaying the election by quoting Article II, Section 1 of the Constitution. https://t.co/gO6y1nirqO https://t.co/JhzCuTz4Dv

name: ABC
text: .@RobinRoberts on the legacy of civil rights icon John Lewis: "It was always special to be in his presence -- uplifting, encouraging." https://t.co/gAEvZoCIEf https://t.co/yKSyhxjg9G

name: ABC
text: .@DavidMuir reports from Atlanta on the funeral of John Lewis: "In conservation with John Lewis he was relatively soft-spoken...but so commanding when he would speak about equality and justice for all." https://t.co/sVteeuYRLu https://t.co/iqKWfucaLt

name: ABC
text: .@michaelstrahan on John Lewis: "For almost 60 years he taught us that anywhere you see injustice, don't be afraid. It is your obligation to speak up." https://t.co/gAEvZoCIEf https://t.co/mSwRTt7hdt

name: ABC
text:
.@SteveOsunsami on John Lewis:

"He was beloved.

And you saw that with the lines of people who waited in the heat and humidity to say their final goodbye." https://t.co/gAEvZoCIEf https://t.co/7Ixn9hoXCd

name: ABC
text: RT @ABCPolitics: Former Pres. Bill Clinton arrives at the historic Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta to pay tribute to civil rights legend John Lewis. https://t.co/PDxRwFEXTp https://t.co/u2VM4rBUaz

name: ABC
text:
“We may not all be in the same room, but we are all on the same page, and we are in touch with the same spirit. We love John Robert Lewis."

Mourners rise in resounding tribute to John Lewis in Atlanta: https://t.co/sVteeuYRLu https://t.co/5zNBWRb2AA

name: ABC
text: Speaker Nancy Pelosi arrives at the funeral for civil rights icon John Lewis; they were colleagues in the House for more than 30 years. https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/BLC1j15M6n

name: ABC
text:
Rev. Dr. Raphael G. Warnock honors John Lewis.

"He was wounded for America's transgressions.

Bruised for our inequities.

The chastisement of our peace was upon him.

And by his stripes, we are healed." https://t.co/sVteeuYRLu https://t.co/fw7vL8eZT0

name: ABC
text: Rev. Dr. Bernice King, MLK Jr.'s daughter, while honoring John Lewis: "Grant us God, a double portion for anointing, to get into good trouble until black bodies are no longer a threat in this world and black lives have equitable representation." https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/bCFqtH6z3x

name: ABC
text:
Rev. Dr. Raphael G. Warnock: "Only John Lewis could compel 3 living American presidents to come to this house of God to celebrate his life."

The honorable George W. Bush
The honorable William Jefferson Clinton
The honorable Barack Obama

https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/XlksdDonTj

name: ABC
text:
"John Lewis believed in the Lord. He believed in humanity. And he believed in America."

Former Pres. George W. Bush remembers civil rights icon John Lewis. https://t.co/sVteeuYRLu https://t.co/fbnCd8wF4p

name: ABC
text:
Former Pres. Bill Clinton on John Lewis: "He was after all a human being. 

A man like all other humans, born with strengths that he made the most of when many don't. 

Born with weaknesses that he worked hard to beat down when many can't." https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/M1Z3inXrw7

name: ABC
text: Former Pres. Bill Clinton on John Lewis: "We are here today because he had the kind of character he showed when he lost an election." https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/ayflcNX7F2

name: ABC
text: Former Pres. Bill Clinton: "In Selma, on the third attempt, John and his comrades showed that sometimes you have to walk into the wind, along with with it." https://t.co/sVteeuYRLu https://t.co/XbxkdvpDm2

name: ABC
text:
Speaker Nancy Pelosi on John Lewis: 

"He was always about young people...he said to them: 'Together you can redeem the world.'" https://t.co/u2GAajmbuB https://t.co/7ndVIkiiNX

name: ABC
text:
"When he spoke, people listened. When he led, people followed."

Speaker Nancy Pelosi remembers the late Rep. John Lewis. https://t.co/sVteeuYRLu https://t.co/NpJ9bfJo8h

name: ABC
text: Mourners react outside Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta during the funeral for Rep. John Lewis. https://t.co/Hv6P8y2Pnj https://t.co/ZTbugPQqWU

name: ABC
text: Activist James M. Lawson pays tribute to the Civil Rights Movement: "We swore to God that, by God's grace, we would do whatever God called us to do in order to put on the table of the nation's agenda: This must end: Black lives matter!" https://t.co/sVteeuYRLu https://t.co/zNTIqd4Pin

name: ABC
text: James M. Lawson: "We do not need bipartisan politics if we're going to celebrate the life of John Lewis. We need the Constitution to come alive!" https://t.co/sVteeuYRLu https://t.co/AMQr3zdoWZ

name: ABC
text: Former President Jimmy Carter sends statement to be read by Rev. Dr. Raphael G. Warnock at John Lewis' funeral: "While his achievements are enjoyed by all Americans, we Georgians know him as our neighbor, friend and representative." https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/8LiHRKMTiZ

name: ABC
text: People watch on a large screen outside the funeral service for civil rights leader John Lewis at Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta, Georgia. https://t.co/awrNmJznBa https://t.co/MOWSUlwvGr

name: ABC
text:
"Salute, suit up and march on."

Pres. Bill Clinton honors John Lewis. https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/zugoJuTLEb

name: ABC
text: Former Atlanta Mayor Bill Campbell on John Lewis: "John was a women's rights hero, a gay rights hero, a senior rights hero, a worker's hero, an immigrant's rights hero. John wasn't on the right side of history. History was on the right side of John Lewis." https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/ji7CaQCM5p

name: ABC
text:
"Let a double portion of what John Lewis' life was about fall on us in this hour so that we can continue to get in good trouble."

Rev. Dr. Bernice King, daughter of Martin Luther King Jr., delivers remarks at the funeral of Rep. John Lewis. https://t.co/dptGHFcQaZ https://t.co/8kIh3SMbGT

name: ABC
text: A mother and her son watch the funeral for civil rights leader John Lewis on a screen outside the historic Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta, Georgia. https://t.co/GFJissrm77 https://t.co/lvb3vHfZ7A

name: ABC
text:
RT @ABCPolitics: The staff of long-serving Rep. John Lewis honored at his funeral service in Atlanta.

Lewis spent more than three decades in Congress representing the 5th Congressional District of Georgia. https://t.co/PDxRwFEXTp https://t.co/ghGEs8H2fL

name: ABC
text: LATEST: Ohio Board of Pharmacy withdraws its new rule prohibiting the sale or distribution of hydroxychloroquine for COVID-19 after facing opposition from Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine. https://t.co/L8K72a8tqr https://t.co/l13Z63hExb

name: ABC
text:
Rev. Dr. Raphael G. Warnock recounts story of John Lewis asking former President Barack Obama to sign his program at Obama's presidential inauguration: He signed the program in this way: 
"Because of you, John."
https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/bGM23qp5l8

name: ABC
text: Former President Barack Obama eulogizes John Lewis: "It is a great honor to be back in Ebenezer Baptist Church, in the pulpit of its greatest pastor, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., to pay my respects to perhaps his finest disciple." https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/g9JUWiou0i

name: ABC
text:
"This country is a constant work in progress," Pres. Barack Obama says. "What gives each new generation purpose it to take up the unfinished work of the last."

John Lewis "not only embraced that responsibility—but he made it his life's work." https://t.co/sVteeuYRLu https://t.co/seemVXDXwi

name: ABC
text: Former President Barack Obama on John Lewis and Bernard Lafayette boarding a segregated bus: "Imagine the courage of two people Malia's age, younger than my oldest daughter, on their own to challenge an entire infrastructure of oppression." https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/Ee5ESZ5u5j

name: ABC
text: Former Pres. Barack Obama: "Like John the Baptist, preparing the way. Like those Old Testament prophets, speaking truth to kings. John Lewis did not hesitate...[he] marched again and again—on a mission to change America." https://t.co/sVteeuYRLu https://t.co/v3s0EdbSYv

name: ABC
text: Activist James M. Lawson pays tribute to the Civil Rights Movement: "We swore to God that, by God's grace, we would do whatever God called us to do in order to put on the table of the nation's agenda. This must end. Black lives matter." https://t.co/dSCRtY3SYj https://t.co/lyiy5CPNLH

name: ABC
text: Former President Obama on John Lewis sitting at a segregated lunch counter in 1960: "Refusing to let a milkshake poured on their heads, or a cigarette extinguished on their backs or a foot aimed at their ribs - refused to let that dent their dignity." https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/hoRI1Gpwip

name: ABC
text: Former President Obama: "America was built by John Lewises. He as much as anyone in our history brought this country a little bit closer to our highest ideals." https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/BFo4KI1EIk

name: ABC
text: Former Pres. Barack Obama on the violent events of Bloody Sunday: "When John woke up and checked himself out of the hospital, he would make sure the world saw a movement that was, in the words of Scripture, hard-pressed on every side—but not crushed." https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/NFxf0PyGmP

name: ABC
text: Former Pres. Barack Obama: "Someday, when we do finish that long journey towards freedom, when we do form a more perfect union...John Lewis will be a Founding Father of that fuller, fairer, better America." https://t.co/sVteeuYRLu https://t.co/mflmy3o4HU

name: ABC
text: Former President Obama: "Today we witness with our own eyes police officers kneeling on the necks of Black Americans. George Wallace may be gone, but we can witness our federal gov't sending agents to use tear gas and batons against peaceful demonstrators” https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/D9ZzIbbR3y

name: ABC
text: Former Pres. Obama: "Even as we sit here, there are those in power who are doing their darndest to discourage peopl… https://t.co/lC6kjttDPm

name: ABC
text: Former Pres. Obama: "Even as we sit here, there are those in power who are doing their darnedest to discourage peop… https://t.co/0YrHHsybhv

name: ABC
text: Former Pres. Obama: "Even as we sit here, there are those in power who are doing their darndest to discourage peopl… https://t.co/dQhR74KzTf

name: ABC
text: Former Pres. Obama: "I know this is a celebration of John's life. There are some who might say we shouldn't dwell on such things. But that's why I'm talking about it." https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP

name: ABC
text: RT @ABCPolitics: Former Pres. Barack Obama: "John Lewis devoted his time on this earth fighting the very attacks on democracy and what's best in America that we're seeing circulate right now." https://t.co/PDxRwFEXTp https://t.co/B31XhixuAl

name: ABC
text: RT @GMA: Former Pres. Obama: "If we want our children to grow up in a democracy - not just with elections, but a true democracy - a representative democracy and a big-hearted, tolerant, vibrant inclusive America...then we're gonna have to be more like John."  https://t.co/nEGcqWA1Ra https://t.co/N40l5EqFg7

name: ABC
text: Former Pres. Obama: "That's what John Lewis teaches us - that's where real courage comes from - not from turning on each other but by turning towards one another. Not by sowing hatred." https://t.co/u1nsPN51AP https://t.co/ZpIzOTfwFs

name: ABC
text:
"If politicians want to honor John," former Pres. Barack Obama says, "there's a better way than a statement calling him a hero."

"Let's honor him by revitalizing the law that he was willing to die for." https://t.co/sVteeuYRLu https://t.co/NCUsHMIIkP

name: ABC
text: JUST IN: Former Pres. Barack Obama calls for action to ensure "every American is automatically registered to vote, including former inmates...adding polling places and expanding early voting, and making Election Day a national holiday." https://t.co/sVteeuYRLu https://t.co/edd0s24E7Q
